Key Match Events: Denmark scored first through Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg in the first minute.
Sweden equalized through Alexander Isak in the seventh minute.
Christian Eriksen scored the winning goal in the 86th minute.
Eriksen's performance was described as a'masterclass'.
Pre-Game Insights: Sweden's Danish coach Jon Dahl Tomasson was inducted into the Danish football Hall Of Fame.
Denmark coach Kasper Hjulmand credited Tomasson for his work with Sweden.
Post-Match Reflections: Denmark's coach Kasper Hjulmand said they gave away too many turnovers in the first half.
He also stated they must look at the opportunities Sweden got, as they must not give them chances.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at Parken Stadium in Copenhagen.
The match was a pre-Euro 2024 friendly.
Others: Christian Eriksen almost preferred the assist for the opening goal over scoring the winner.
Eriksen came in for criticism for poor set pieces in qualifying.
